item.title: Microsoft Engineer Scott Seiber on Early AI with Microsoft Bob's Rover and Our AI Future
item.description:
Register for Microsoft Build - https://build.microsoft.com
Scott helped revolutionize how Microsoft software operates on Mac, bridging the Windows-Mac divide long before cross-platform excellence was the norm. He also contributed significantly to Microsoft Bob, a daring initiative designed to bring a human touch to computing by creating an engaging, accessible interface. Join me as we explore the fascinating stories behind these pivotal contributions!
Scott on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/scott-seiber-46088a/
Chapters: 00:00 - Intro 01:05 - Scott's Origin Story 03:00 - Natural Computing with Bob 04:15 - Software Engineer Journey 08:20 - Infusing AI into work and live 09:30 - Why Still at Microsoft & Future Excitement? 11:04 - Wrap-up
Join this channel to get access to perks: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCENTmbKaTphpWV2R2evVz2A/join

item.title: Diving into the .NET World: Beginner's Diary #1
item.description:
Welcome to the Journey!
Hello and welcome! If you're like me ‚Äî someone who relishes in the joy of reading, writing, and sharing knowledge ‚Äî you're in for a treat. In this .NET diary series, I'm excited to share interesting insights from the content I consumed when I was a junior developer.

item.title: Desktop is Dead
item.description: The desktop metaphor, first in the Xerox Alto and then the Macintosh, is now 52 years old. It was a good solution to the problem of making non-technical knowledge workers use the computer effectively. But the real fact is that the desktop metaphor has died, and it is limiting computers.

item.title: Coding NEON kernels for the Cortex-A53 ‚Äì Daniel Est√©vez
item.description: Some weeks ago, I presented at FOSDEM my work-in-progress high performance SDR runtime qsdr. I showed a hand-written NEON assembly implementation of a kernel that computes y[n]=ax[n]+b, which I used as the basic math block for benchmarks on a Kria KV260 board (which has a quad-core ARM Cortex-A53 at 1.33 GHz). In that talk I glossed over the details of how I implemented this NEON kernel. There are enough tricks and considerations that I could make a full talk just out of explaining how to write this kernel. This will be the topic for this post.

item.title: .NET AI Community Stand Up - .NET Tokenizers & Real-World MCP in Action
item.description:
Join Bruno Capuano and Tarek Sayed for a hands-on session designed for .NET developers diving into the world of AI.
üîπ Part 1 introduces the .NET Tokenizers library: learn how modern tokenization works, why it‚Äôs critical in AI workloads, and how to use the NuGet package with real examples. üîπ Part 2 shifts gears to the Model Context Protocol (MCP): explore the full eShopLite sample, showing MCP clients and servers implemented in .NET and integrated into an intelligent, real-world scenario.
Whether you're building AI from the ground up or exploring production-ready use cases, this session has you covered!
Community Links: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/collections/ng62sjto80z6n8
Featuring: Bruno Capuano (@elbruno), Tarek Sayed
item.author: (dotnet)
